news_headline: I am glad to be leaving Chennai, pitch here has stumped me: KKR captain Morgan
news_article: After KKR lost two of their first three matches in Chennai in IPL 2021, captain Eoin Morgan said, "Chennai pitch certainly has stumped me. I'm glad to be leaving Chennai. I can't get a gauge on the wicket." KKR will now head to Mumbai to play their next two games at Wankhede Stadium, where they'll face CSK and then RR.

news_headline: 24-year-old Matt Parkinson recreates Shane Warne's 'ball of the century'
news_article: Lancashire's 24-year-old leg-spinner Matt Parkinson recreated former Australia leg-spinner Shane Warne's 'ball of the century' during a county match against Northamptonshire captain Adam Rossington. Parkinson gave the ball some flight, which pitched outside leg stump, and turned sharply to crash into the top of the off-stump. "Wow! Was that his first ball of the summer too?" Warne tweeted.

news_headline: SL's Lokuhettige banned for 8 years for match-fixing during 2017 T10 League
news_article: Ex-Sri Lanka cricketer Dilhara Lokuhettige has been banned from all cricket for eight years after he was found guilty of three offences, including match-fixing, by an independent Anti-Corruption Tribunal. Lokuhettige was initially charged by Emirates Cricket Board over corruption during the inaugural session of the T10 tournament in Sharjah. Lokuhettige played nine ODIs and two T20Is for SL.

news_headline: South Africa, come on you need this man: Yohan Blake after ABD hits 76*(34)
news_article: After RCB's AB de Villiers smashed 76*(34) against KKR, two-time Olympic gold medal-winning Jamaican sprinter Yohan Blake tweeted, "Wow...De Villiers is on a different level. South Africa...come on...you need this man." AB de Villiers has also stated he and South Africa head coach Mark Boucher will have a chat regarding his chances of featuring in T20 World Cup.

news_headline: Sanju Samson collects coin again after winning toss against MS Dhoni, pic goes viral
news_article: Ahead of the RR-CSK match in IPL 2021, RR captain Sanju Samson collected the coin from the ground and kept it after winning the toss against CSK captain MS Dhoni. The 26-year-old had also kept the coin in the pocket after winning the toss in his first-ever match as IPL captain on April 12.

news_headline: Warner and Williamson keep Ramadan fast with Rashid Khan, spinner shares video
news_article: SunRisers Hyderabad captain David Warner and Kane Williamson kept Ramadan fast with teammate Rashid Khan, the spinner revealed in a video on Instagram. Rashid shared a video of the duo sitting with him at a table ahead of Iftar. In the video, Warner can be heard terming the fasting as "very difficult".

news_headline: Thank you from bottom of my heart: Pandya on completing 6 years with MI
news_article: All-rounder Hardik Pandya took to Twitter to thank his fans and his franchise Mumbai Indians on completing six years in the IPL. Hardik made his debut for MI on this day in 2015 and has since scored 1,384 runs and picked 42 wickets. "To the management, staff, teammates and fans...thank you from the bottom of my heart," he tweeted.

news_headline: Hardik not bowling in IPL 2021 yet due to a niggle: Jayawardene
news_article: MI head coach Mahela Jayawardene said that all-rounder Hardik Pandya hasn't bowled in IPL 2021 so far due to a niggle that he picked during the India-England ODI series. "We don't want to risk an injury...We want to be sure that he is comfortable while bowling so hopefully in the next few weeks...you might see him bowling," Jayawardene explained.

news_headline: It was very crucial: Shaw on Shami's 17th over where he conceded 20 runs
news_article: DC's Prithvi Shaw has said that the 17th over of their successful chase against PBKS's 195-run total was crucial and they "executed quite well". DC needed 36 off 24 balls when Mohammed Shami came to bowl and conceded 20 runs. Stoinis smashed two fours and a six to help DC post 180 after the over, needing 16 off 18 balls.

news_headline: MI have adapted pretty well to competitive Chennai wicket: Jayawardene
news_article: Mumbai Indians head coach Mahela Jayawardene said his side has adapted pretty well to the competitive Chennai wicket in the IPL as all the games are being played at neutral venues and no team gets home advantage. “Yes, the wickets are slightly on the slower side. They are not unplayable wickets, they are good competitive wickets,” added Jayawardene.

news_headline: After coming from Australia, I was worried about my batting: Shaw
news_article: DC's Prithvi Shaw, who has scored 106 runs in three IPL matches, has revealed he was worried about his batting after his performance in Australia. Shaw scored 0 and 4 in the single Test he played in Australia. "I played my natural game in Vijay Hazare Trophy, but I made a small technical change. After that...it's going well," he stated.

news_headline: PBKS messed up their bowling plans vs DC: Ashish Nehra
news_article: Criticising KL Rahul's captaincy, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said Punjab Kings "messed up" their bowling plans against DC while defending their 195-run total. "Even Shami bowled four overs in four different spells...PBKS played four different bowlers to start with," he stated, adding that such things are mostly done by those sides who lack resources.

news_headline: Dew played ‘big factor’: Agarwal on PBKS' loss against DC
news_article: Punjab Kings opening batsman Mayank Agarwal pointed out that the dew played a 'big factor' in his side's six-wicket loss against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2021 on Sunday. "Delhi Capitals batted exceedingly well, also there was a dew factor. It was not that easy," said Mayank. The right-handed batsman's 69-run knock helped PBKS put up a score of 195/4.

news_headline: Did well to keep Punjab Kings under 200 runs: Stoinis after DC's win
news_article: After chasing the target of 196 runs, Delhi Capitals all-rounder Marcus Stoinis said that his side did "really well" in keeping Punjab Kings under the 200-run mark in IPL 2021 on Sunday. "The focus is always to start well. Shikhar Dhawan is brilliant, he's really hungry for runs," added Stoinis. Dhawan's 92-run knock helped DC beat PBKS by six wickets.

news_headline: It suits Maxwell to play without having to carry the team: Swann
news_article: Talking about the performance of Glenn Maxwell, who has scored 176 runs so far in IPL, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said it suits the Australia all-rounder to perform without having to carry the team. "He's not the big show...he's got Kohli, De Villiers...and it suits him to be that third player who can just go and express himself," Swann explained.

news_headline: Dock points, impose fine: Neville on clubs of European Super League
news_article: Ex-England and Manchester United defender Gary Neville has slammed the 12 founding clubs of the breakaway 'European Super League'. Neville said the six Premier League clubs that are part of the new league should get their points deducted, be fined and have transfer embargo imposed. "I hope they haven't bought some of the other 14 (Premier League) clubs," Neville tweeted.

news_headline: Discus thrower Krishna Poonia tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Commonwealth Games gold medallist discus thrower Krishna Poonia on Sunday tested positive for COVID-19 and is undergoing treatment at a Jaipur hospital. "She was not in a serious condition and was doing fine otherwise. Doctors have advised her to be at hospital for a few days," said Krishna's husband Virender Poonia. Krishna is currently a sitting MLA in Rajasthan.

news_headline: Dhawan looks solid even while playing fearless cricket: Kaif
news_article: DC assistant coach Mohammad Kaif has praised Shikhar Dhawan, who has scored 85 and 92 in two of his three IPL matches, for his fearless batting. "Dhawan...looks solid even while playing fearless cricket. Cutting risks without compromising the strike rate is the mark of a great T20 batsman," Kaif tweeted. DC have won both matches when Dhawan crossed 50-run mark.

news_headline: Former footballer Pelé's trading cards to be launched as NFTs
news_article: Community-oriented platform Ethernity Chain has announced that it will launch a collection of authenticated non-fungible tokens (NFTs) to "honour the legacy" of former Brazilian footballer Pelé. It will mark the first time for Pelé trading cards to be released digitally, Ethernity Chain said. It added, 90% of the proceeds from the sale of NFTs will go to The Pelé Foundation.

news_headline: Tottenham Hotspur sack manager Jose Mourinho: Report
news_article: With Tottenham winning just once in their past six games, the club on Monday reportedly sacked manager Jose Mourinho. Currently, Tottenham are seventh in Premier League standings and were knocked out of the Europa League last month following a 3-2 aggregate defeat against Dinamo Zagreb in the round of 16. Mourinho was appointed as manager in November 2019.

news_headline: Britain adds India to travel 'red list' amid 'concerns over new COVID-19 variant'
news_article: Britain has added India to its 'red list' of countries from which most travel to the UK is banned, reports said on Monday. The move comes amid concerns over a new variant of coronavirus, UK Health Secretary Matt Hancock was quoted as saying by BBC. It effectively bans all arrivals from India except for British or Irish nationals.

news_headline: Hong Kong bans flights from India after detecting N501Y mutant COVID-19 strain
news_article: Hong Kong has suspended flights from India, Pakistan and the Philippines from April 20 for two weeks after the N501Y mutant COVID-19 strain was detected there for the first time, authorities said in a statement on Sunday. Hong Kong has also placed the three countries under the category of "extremely high-risk Group A", according to an official release.

news_headline: UK PM Boris Johnson's India visit cancelled in view of COVID-19 situation
news_article: The Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said that it was decided by a mutual agreement that the United Kingdom's Prime Minister Boris Johnson will not visit India next week in view of the COVID-19 situation. "The two sides will be holding a virtual meeting in the coming days to launch plans for a transformed India-UK relationship," the MEA added.

news_headline: Oxford University to reinfect recovered COVID-19 patients for study
news_article: The University of Oxford in a first-of-its-kind trial will deliberately reinfect people who have fought off the COVID-19 virus. Sixty-four healthy, previously COVID-19 infected volunteers aged between 18-30 years, will be studied under controlled and quarantined conditions for at least 17 days. It will help researchers examine what kind of immune response could prevent reinfection from COVID-19.

news_headline: Tesla electric car with no one in driver's seat crashes into tree in US, 2 killed
news_article: A Tesla electric car with no one in driver's seat crashed into a tree in US' Texas, killing two. One of the persons was sitting in the front passenger seat and another in a rear passenger seat, police said. The car was reportedly travelling fast and failed to navigate a turn before hitting a tree and bursting into flames.

news_headline: 300-million-yr-old ‘Godzilla Shark' discovered in 2013 gets formal name
news_article: A shark that was discovered in New Mexico in May 2013 and was initially called "Godzilla Shark" has received a formal name. The 300-million-year-old shark, whose fossils were found at a dig east of Albuquerque, has been named Dracopristis hoffmanorum or Hoffman's Dragon Shark. The name honours the family that owns the land where the fossils were found.

news_headline: Nearly 100 injured after passenger train derails in Egypt
news_article: At least 97 people were injured after a passenger train derailed in Egypt on Sunday, the Egyptian Health Ministry said. Over 50 ambulances were sent to the scene and the wounded were transferred to public hospitals, it added. Two security sources and local media reported that several people had been killed in the accident, but there was no official confirmation.

news_headline: Former sheriff's deputy shoots dead three people in US, absconding
news_article: A former sheriff's deputy allegedly shot dead three people in Austin, Texas on Sunday and is since absconding, said officials. The suspect, Stephen Broderick, was arrested for sexual assault of a child last year and was released on $50,000 bond, officials added. Police said the victims - two Hispanic women and one Black man - were all known to Broderick.

news_headline: Australia, New Zealand open quarantine-free travel bubble
news_article: Australia and New Zealand on Monday opened a travel bubble between them that doesn't require the travellers to quarantine. "Today's milestone is a win-win for Australians and New Zealanders, boosting our economies while keeping our people safe," Australian PM Scott Morrison said. The two countries have been successful in controlling the spread of coronavirus and keeping the infection rates low.

news_headline: UK opp'n urges PM to cancel India visit over new COVID-19 variant
news_article: The UK's opposition Labour Party on Sunday called on PM Boris Johnson to cancel his visit to India amid growing concerns of a new "double mutant" COVID-19 variant detected in the country. "I can't see why the PM can't conduct his business with the Indian government via Zoom," a Labour leader said. The COVID-19 variant was discovered last month.

news_headline: Half of US adults have received at least 1 shot of COVID-19 vaccine
news_article: More than 50% of all adults, nearly 13 crore people, in America have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) announced on Sunday. Almost 8.4 crore adults have been fully vaccinated, the CDC added. The US is the worst coronavirus hit country with over 3.10 crore cases.

news_headline: S Korea proposes law to ban internet file-sharing with N Korea
news_article: South Korea on Monday proposed a law that would require its citizens to get official permission before using the internet to exchange digital material with anyone in North Korea. A law already regulates physical goods sent into or out of North Korea, a government spokesperson said. In December, South Korea had banned the launching of propaganda leaflets into the North.

news_headline: China could remove Gates & Jobs' biographies from schools: Report
news_article: The Chinese government could remove Microsoft Founder Bill Gates and Apple Founder Steve Jobs' biographies from reading lists and libraries in primary and secondary schools, Business Insider reported citing Nikkei Asia's report. All books that "worship foreigners" will be removed from schools' reading lists, a move that affects around 240 million students, Epoch Times reported.

news_headline: We're uncomfortable with expanding Five Eyes: NZ foreign minister
news_article: New Zealand's Foreign Affairs Minister Nanaia Mahuta said on Monday that the country was "uncomfortable" with expanding the role of the 'Five Eyes', an intelligence alliance between the US, UK, Australia, Canada and New Zealand. The group had in November last year criticised China on its "actions against Hong Kong's legislature". China is New Zealand's largest trading partner.

news_headline: China's population to enter negative growth after 2025: Report
news_article: China's population is set to experience a negative growth after 2025 that will result in a shortage of consumer demand, South China Morning Post reported quoting a Chinese economist. "We need to pay attention to the impact of demographics on future consumption," the economist said. The comments come as China is due to release its latest census later this month.

news_headline: Russia has massed over 1.5 lakh soldiers near Ukraine: EU
news_article: Russia has massed over 1.5 lakh troops along the Ukrainian border and in annexed Crimea, European Union (EU) foreign policy chief Josep Borrell said on Monday. "It is the highest Russian military deployment at Ukrainian borders ever," he added. Tensions between Russia and Ukraine have been rising amid the military build-up and clashes between Ukrainian forces and pro-Russian separatists.

news_headline: Japan seeks release of Japanese journalist detained in Myanmar
news_article: The Japanese government said on Monday that it was seeking the release of a Japanese journalist who was detained in Yangon by Myanmar authorities a day earlier. Japanese Chief Cabinet Secretary Katsunobu Kato said that the government was seeking details on the circumstances surrounding the detention. BBC Burmese quoted a witness saying that journalist Yuki Kitazumi was taken into custody.

news_headline: No guarantees about Afghanistan's future after our troops leave: US
news_article: No one can offer guarantees about Afghanistan's future after American troops leave, US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan said. "All the US could do is provide...the Afghan government and the Afghan people resources and...assistance," he added. "We've done that and now it's time for...Afghan people to step up to defend their own country," Sullivan further said.

news_headline: France bears responsibility for enabling genocide that killed 8L: Rwanda
news_article: France "bears significant responsibility" for enabling the Rwandan genocide that left 8 lakh people dead, a report by Rwanda said. France "did nothing to stop" the massacres in 1994 and in the years after the genocide tried to cover up its role and even offered protection to some perpetrators, it added. Groups of extremist Hutus had mainly killed ethnic Tutsis.

news_headline: 11 policemen held hostage by banned TLP released: Pak Interior Min
news_article: Pakistan's Interior Minister Sheikh Rashid Ahmed said on Monday that 11 policemen being held hostage by banned Islamist party Tehreek-e-Labbaik Pakistan (TLP) have been released. He added that TLP members have retreated inside a masjid. Protests had erupted in Pakistan over TLP head Saad Hussain Rizvi's arrest after he demanded the French ambassador be expelled over depictions of Prophet Muhammad.

news_headline: Former Bihar Minister and JD(U) MLA Mewalal Choudhary dies due to COVID-19
news_article: Former Bihar Education Minister and JD(U) MLA Mewalal Choudhary passed away due to COVID-19 at a hospital in Patna on Monday morning. The minister had tested positive for COVID-19 last week. Choudhary, who was the sitting MLA of Bihar's Tarapur constituency, was earlier removed as the state Education Minister on corruption charges.

news_headline: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao tests positive for COVID-19
news_article: Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrashekar Rao tested positive for COVID-19 on Monday. "He has mild symptoms. He has been advised isolation and is staying at his farmhouse. A team of doctors is monitoring his health," said the state Chief Secretary. Telangana currently has 39,154 active COVID-19 cases and more than 1,800 people have died of the infection so far.

news_headline: It's a short lockdown, don't leave Delhi: CM Kejriwal to migrant workers
news_article: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday appealed to the migrant labourers to not leave the capital after announcing a lockdown. He said, "I appeal to you with folded hands. It's a small lockdown, only for six days. Don't leave Delhi." He added, "I'm very hopeful that we won't need to further extend the lockdown...The government will take care of you."

news_headline: States must keep oxygen demand under control: Piyush Goyal
news_article: Amid reports of shortage of medical oxygen in several states, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said state governments should keep their demand under control. He said, "We need to use medical oxygen rationally and stop wastage. Patients should be given required amount of oxygen only." He added, "There are reports about patients being given oxygen even if they don't need it."

news_headline: Health Minister responds to Dr Manmohan Singh's suggestions on vaccination
news_article: Health Minister Dr Harsh Vardhan on Monday responded to former PM Dr Manmohan Singh's letter to PM Narendra Modi on ramping up COVID-19 vaccination. Vardhan said, "It's saddening that while you understand importance of vaccination...people...in state governments formed by your party don't share your view." He alleged that Congress leaders 'publically shamed' the vaccines but took them in private.

news_headline: Ex-PM Manmohan Singh tests positive for COVID-19; admitted to AIIMS in Delhi
news_article: Former Prime Minister Dr Manmohan Singh tested positive for coronavirus and was admitted to the Trauma Centre at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) in Delhi on Monday. The 88-year-old senior Congress leader had on Sunday written a letter addressed to PM Narendra Modi, offering suggestions on how to ramp up COVID-19 vaccination in India.

news_headline: Rajasthan Health Minister alleges discrimination in oxygen supply
news_article: Rajasthan Health Minister Raghu Sharma on Monday accused the Centre of discrimination, claiming while 1,200 metric tonne oxygen was supplied to Gujarat, his state got only 124 metric tonne. "Number of COVID-19 cases in Rajasthan and Gujarat are equal," he said. Rajasthan government has ordered the procurement of 1,500 oxygen condensers, which will provide oxygen to 3,000 patients, Sharma added.

news_headline: I will put coronavirus in Fadnavis' mouth if I find it: Sena MLA over Remdesivir row
news_article: Shiv Sena MLA Sanjay Gaikwad has said if he had found coronavirus, he would have put it into the mouth of BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis. This comes after the former Chief Minister objected to Mumbai Police's interrogation of a pharmaceutical company's top executive over alleged stocking of Remdesivir drug. BJP workers staged protests and burnt Gaikwad's effigies after his remarks.

news_headline: K'taka govt planning to postpone local body polls due to COVID-19
news_article: The Karnataka government is planning to postpone Zilla Panchayat and Taluk Panchayat elections due to the surge in COVID-19 cases, said state Minister for Rural Development and Panchayat Raj, K S Eshwarappa. The issue will be discussed by the State Cabinet and the decision would be conveyed to the Karnataka State Election Commission, Eshwarappa stated.

news_headline: See Maharashtra's situation instead of accusing us: BJP to Priyanka
news_article: Maharashtra BJP chief spokesperson Keshav Upadhye on Monday criticised Priyanka Gandhi Vadra for accusing former state Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis for allegedly hoarding Remdesivir. He said, "There is a crisis-like situation in Maharashtra. Shortage of beds, ventilators and oxygen have led people to die on the streets. Why cannot you [Priyanka] see that instead of accusing BJP."

news_headline: Mulayam Singh didn't vote in UP Panchayat polls: Nephew Dharmendra
news_article: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav did not cast his vote in Uttar Pradesh Panchayat elections on Monday. This is the first time that the 81-year old didn't vote. "We requested Netaji (Mulayam Singh Yadav) not to cast his vote this time for the Panchayat elections in the wake of COVID-19 pandemic," said Dharmendra Yadav, nephew of Mulayam Singh Yadav.

news_headline: Maharashtra must set up welfare office in K'taka's Belagavi: Raut
news_article: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Sunday said Maharashtra government must set up an office in Belagavi, a district in Karnataka which Maharashtra claims is Marathi-speaking and therefore must be merged with the state. He said the state should strengthen its stand against Karnataka in boundary dispute case and Maharashtra's advocate general should meet Marathi-speaking people in the border areas.

news_headline: National security jeopardised by govt: Rahul on talks with China
news_article: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday hit out at the government saying that national security is "massively jeopardised" by its "wasteful talks" with China. "Chinese occupation of Gogra-Hot Springs and Depsang plains is a direct threat to India's strategic interests including the [Daulat Beg Oldi] airstrip," he added. Earlier, India and China held the 11th round of talks on disengagement.

news_headline: Allow us to get vaccines directly with state funds: Mamata to PM
news_article: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee on Sunday wrote a letter to PM Narendra Modi once again seeking the Centre's permission to "purchase [COVID-19] vaccination doses directly with state funds and launch a massive free vaccination campaign in the state covering the entire population". She also said that the supply of vaccines from the Centre has been "scarce and erratic".

news_headline: BJD won't hold any public rallies for Pipili bypoll: Odisha CM
news_article: In view of the rising coronavirus cases, Odisha Chief Minister Naveen Patnaik on Monday said that the ruling BJD has decided not to hold any public rallies or campaign meetings for the Pipili bypoll. "I would earnestly appeal to political parties and EC to reconsider both the duration and method of campaigning," added the Chief Minister.

news_headline: Crime against humanity: Priyanka accuses Fadnavis of hoarding Remdesivir
news_article: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra criticised former Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis over the alleged hoarding of Remdesivir injections. "The act of hoarding by the BJP leader who was once in a responsible position is a crime against humanity," Priyanka tweeted. She also shared a video in which Fadnavis and others were seen arguing with police officers.

news_headline: SC rejects plea for 100% matching of VVPAT slips with EVMs count
news_article: The Supreme Court on Monday dismissed a plea seeking 100% matching of VVPAT slips with EVMs count in Assembly elections. The court said, "We're not going to interfere in the middle of election process." In April 2019, the court directed EC to increase random matching of VVPAT slips with EVMs to five booths per assembly segment in Lok Sabha polls.

news_headline: K'taka Home Minister urges KSRTC employees to withdraw strike
news_article: Karnataka Home Minister Basavaraj S Bommai on Monday said that he had a meeting with Kodihalli Chandrashekar, who is leading Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) employees' strike, and has asked him to withdraw the strike and return to work. KSRTC employees have given a call for a strike with certain demands including salary hike, permanent job, wages and shifts.

news_headline: PM Modi not demonstrating role as PM: CPI(M) on Bengal poll rallies
news_article: The CPI(M) on Sunday alleged that Prime Minister Narendra Modi is demonstrating his role as a "partisan party campaigner" and not that of country's PM. Referring to BJP rallies in Bengal, CPI(M) General Secretary Sitaram Yechury said, "PM's priority is the election campaign. If any time is left, he does something perfunctory for TV images and headlines. A sorry state."

news_headline: Phase 2 of UP Panchayat polls tomorrow; Lucknow, Varanasi to vote
news_article: Voting for the second phase of the Uttar Pradesh Panchayat polls will be held on Monday. More than 3.48 lakh candidates are in the fray for over 2.23 lakh posts in 20 districts. The second phase assumes significance as state capital Lucknow and Varanasi will go to polls in this round.
